From the iron work to the intricate ceiling, to the chapel and finally the roof, there is no better example of Gaudi's genius in building a home. Simply amazing!

An amazing and rather peaceful visit. Maybe less praised than the other works of Gaudi in Barcelona (and also less crowded) I really recommend the visit of the Palau Guell. You will discover and understand the essence of Gaudi's work, his relation to Eusebi Güell and see an amazing piece of architecture. We did not book online but on a Friday afternoon we did not have to queue contrary to other attraction in Barcelona.

Another beautiful Gaudi creation. Don't miss a visit to this mansion in the old El Revel section off of Las Ramblas. Best to buy your tickets on line during peak tourist season, but we visited in November and got in right away.
Gaudi, guadi, gaudi!. very nice place to spend a day outdoors. Don't go if the weather is not nice. taxi is worthwhile as walk from metro is all uphill

You get a lot for your money!. This is the cheapest house, building of Gaudi you can visit but you get a lot for your money: acces to all the rooms, free but very interesting audio guide and a reasonable number op visitors so it's not too crowded
I like. Very nice to see. It's interesting to look upon and make you think. Not a must but if you have 2 hours to spend go and take a look.
Did not make our Top 10!. Not as impressive as we had hoped. There are a few amazing areas and pieces yet after taking the metro and walking a long distance we were disappointed.
an absolute must see. Gaudi was a genius. This place is an absolute must see. Such an amazing place, architecture is insane.

Nice to see it. In the beginning I did not want to visit the park, but finally I made it and happy that I did not missed it. it is not the most and top of Barcelona, but certainly has to be seen for at least 1 hour.
Marilena. Incredible, the audio guide was very helpful and detailed, the chimneys on the roof from a fairytale. I loved it !

Sorry, not for you.. There are "agents" before you buy the ticket and they tell you that park is closed till 2pm, and there already was a long line to wait for tickets...I was there at 12:30...so? What? Should I wait in the line, buy the ticket and wait some more? No thank you. Very unfriendly way of attracting turist...turned arround right on the doors and want back to super part of Barcelona, Barri Gothic.
If you liked La Sagrada.... ...You will like Park Guell. We did. Easy to get to by city bus. Walk down from top to bottom, not the other way round. Many interesting nooks and crannies to explore.

Be careful with the tickets. The Park itself is free, but tickets are sold for the house (where Gaudi himself lived for several years) and for the core part of the park. It is not obvious online that the house ticket is NOT for the core part of the park, so we never got to see the the latter. That said the house was interesting.Both tickets are for specific time slots.

Where do these ideas come from?. Gaudi just continues to amaze.He is own category of art nouveau.You can visualise handsome carriages passengers being wowed when entering.When you have money…you can build whatever!The attention to detail is artistically methodical.Not to be missed if this is your thing.

Slightly under the radar. While the Casa Battlo is so well known, this earlier mansion is the early Gaudi which is still so impressive. The detail for design is just phenomenal. Like so many masterpieces of art, there is just a lack of words for the wonderment each of the areas you are immersed in. The recording is included in the admission and gives more history and insight than most museum headset lectures.
Best architecture marvels. Different style of building and creation.sit down and view Mediterranean from there. There is a bonus.

A shame with the ticket. We try to enter the park after visting the Sagrada, but our travel guide missed the Information that the park costs entrance and the tickets should be book in the Internet, otherwise you wait for several hours to get in. The area, for which you pay the fee is mini, the rest you can walk around for free, crowded with People, only the part with the Gaudis sitting Locations costs extra. Not sure, if the park is worth the Money!

Not worth it. The other Gaudi sights are much more interesting. Between having poor public transportation items to get there and the cost of admission, it really was not that special. Go to the Sagrada Familia instead!

Light everywhere. This has only been restored in the last 2 years. Not to be confused with the Parc Güell.Only Gaudi could redesign a terraced house with cellar into such a sumptuous spacious and light residence. OK it is a large terraced house.Lots of effort was put into ensuring there was natural light everywhere and maximising the use of space (the chapel is more or less a cupboard). Consideration was made by Gaudi for the type of materials, built-in features and his favourite parabolic curves. The chimneys on the roof also don't disappoint.This may be a bit of an irreverent review, but the palace feels like it could easily be a comfortable home and is well worth a visit to see an architectural combination of art and engineering.
Crazy. The Palace Guell was really cool. The architecture was impressive. We did an audio tour which took a couple hours, but was necessary to really get everything in the house.

Too crowded to enjoy!. A wonderful example of Gaudi's approach to living space. I was no able to enjoy it as much because there were so many other tourists there at the same time. It seems that the quality of the visit and enjoyment of the site would be better if there were fewer big tour buses full of visitors - of which we were one!- visiting at the same time.

Beautiful. Loved it but smaller than I thought. Make sure you take the time to wander the wider park and give yourself some relaxation time. It is best to buy a timed ticket a few days in advance so you don't show up and get turned away - esp if you are on a week-end break.

Good but they REALLY need to improve signage there!. More lovely Gaudi....we got a bit lost getting there and finding our way to the entry point. But that aside, the views are good, and plan on combining this with the Miro museum, all of which require tickets purchased in advance!

Modernista but still recognisably Victorian. Wonderful example of Gaudi's creative art and achitectural craftsmanship and skill. Lots of well-thought out practical features such as the wooden cobblestones in the ground floor carriage entrance to muffle the sound of the horse's hooves. Not a huge place so you get the feel of what it was like to live there. Although it is packed full of lovely Modernista features it's still recognisable Victorian, with lots of dark interior and fancy black-and-gold metal work. At 12 euro entry it's a bargain.

A Gaudi Gem. This is a relatively quiet palace to visit, and get a real feel for Gaudi design. It's not crowded . It's a wonderful building filled with treasures . I especially liked the iron doors, and the roof is spectacular. Make extra time for enjoying the mosaics up there! The audio guide is free and really thorough, so don't overlook utilizing it. All the design and all the craftsmanship is astounding!

Worth a Visit. So unassuming from the outside. Only the rooftop mosaic chimneys give you a clue to what you'll find inside. For the price, a very worthwhile visit and I'm glad we saw it. If your time or money are limited and you can only do one Gaudi house, I would do Casa Batllo instead.
OK. Park was interesting but fairly run down. Did not realise until we got there that we had to buy tickets to get into the Palais... so ended up just taking pics from outside
beautiful location good architecture. Loved the modernism work that gaudi had left behind brilliant and refreshing art very unique,with lots of architecture to enjoy and a beautiful location

Gaudi in metal .... We only had time to see this house from the outside and this was our first real taste of Gaudi's imagination….we weren't disappointed. The amazing designs and use of wrought iron on the door was enough to give us a taste of his creativity.

Mandatory. Once in Barcelona, going to this park is mandatory. It is very interesting, with pieces all around of Gaudí art work. It also gives you a great view of the city, and you can also visit Gaudi´s house Museum which was the residence of Antoni Gaudí.

Gaudi's Masterpiece. At least that is my opinion. The only downside is that it is a mob scene to get in and there are always people in your photos. The architecture is very unique and I love architecture. The house is simple on the lower level and gets more grandiose as you go up all the way to the roof.

Worth a visit!. We happened upon Palau Guell quite by accident on our first day in Barcelona as we were wondering around with no particular agenda but to see where our feet and eyes took us. There was no line to get in and, once inside, significantly less crowded than all of the other Gaudi attractions. Amazing details and, while allegedly darker than his later works, still full of treats for the eyes. As with all things Gaudi, the roof was, by far, my favorite space. Those chimneys, wow! Plus, incredible views. Definitely a must see whether you are a Gaudi fan or not!
Gaudi very different. This is the home he built for the Guell family and the tall central room is a very interesting feature. It also has an interesting roof and gorgeous stables.

Whimsical playground. What can I say?The playful, colorful architectures are masterpieces. If you want to take a picture with the lizard, don't go there in summer!After visiting there, you'll see everything mosaic as very Park Güell-ish, you'll never be able to see buildings as the "normal" way before.
breathtaking view. Nice park. good palace. but the best part is the view. Awesome. you could just sit there, looking over the city.

Lines & more Lines. We arrived on a Monday afternoon at 12-45 and next available tickets was at 4-00 Pm. Everywhere you looked there were lines of people waiting for entry to this & that.Lots of traders selling there "tat" throughout the park area, toilet areas not well signed, plus self service snack area.Overall not rated - having said that the lady playing harp was good.

Must see. Make sure to buy tickets on line. We had to wait 2:30 hours. A lot of the property is free to explor but the main section in the center you need the tickets. A lot of stairs. We went to the top and entered the gate and walked down.
Impressive. Whether you are into architecture or not you will enjoy this amazing building. A work of art and practical at the same time. Go there!

For Gaudi fans only. Busy place. Be prepared to wait for your entrance to the inside that was designed by Gaudi. You do have to pay for another entrance fee to the Gaudi Museum. Enjoyed the walk in the Park while waiting for the timed entrance, though.
amazing views. Beautiful place displaying the best of gaudi and stunning views out to sea. A really lovely place to wander around with lots of seating and picnic areas.

go there. order from the wed 2 says before you are comming and take the ticket before 9:00 am from the park- nice and good view
enjoy
Disapointing.. The park is nice outside but i waited in the line for 30 mins to get inside an empty house and watch videos that i can find online..

Astounding !!. Even though this would not be a place I would like to live (aparently Guell's wife thought the same) it is still an amazing sight and the genius architecture by Gaudi still astounds me , from the lower level where horses were kept to the roof top chimneys , I really enjoyed this tour (audio) .... we had an afternoon spare and we thought we would take a look and it was well worth the visit , if you like Gaudi architecture in all it's intricate detail and meaning it is a must !!!
Must see hands down!. after la Sagrada Familla this is a must. Guide books suggest it but d o not emphasize it. I will! Spectacular and impressive.

Slightly disappointing. This was going to be Gaudi's masterpiece of a new village - but they only sold 1 of 60 houses. You now have to pay to get to the central area (despite what your guidebook may say!) and pay again if you want to go into Gaudi's house. Realistically there are some columns, the viaducts (inc Washerwoman) and some fancy mosaic work.It's a nice park to visit, but lots of people hanging around waiting for their time to go into the centre. There are better places which are more convenient to the centre of town to get a flavour of art nouveau

Breathtaking Gaudi sight in Barca - Do Not Miss!. While in Barcelona for 5 days, we saw many of the Gaudi buildings. This one rates #2 in my book right after La Sagrada Familia, with #3 being Park Guell. This house is simply a stunning work of gothic and art noveau style, and each room was better than the last with amazing intricacies with every turn. The highlight of which is the roof top, which includes the beautiful chimneys and an amazing panoramic view of the city of Barcelona. If you can only choose 3 Gaudi sites to visit, skip Casa Batllo and replace it with the Guell Palace. Casa Batllo is interesting, but the Guell Palace is simply stunning. Additionally, it is less visited because it was closed for many years for renovation. Lastly, the price of this attraction is more than half the price of the Casa Batllo, and in my opinion visiting the inside of both - a must see in Barcelona.

Absolutely Stunning. Guëll Palace, which is a mansion that was owned by the wealthy industrialist, Eusebi Guëll, and designed by the architect, Antoni Gaudi, should not be confused with the Parque Guëll (Guëll Park) that was named after the same family. The palace, or town house, is absolutely stunning. We rented the audio guide for our tour, and it was well worth it, because each room was a masterpiece of Gaudi’s genius and creativity. Guëll obviously wanted every detail of his home to be perfection itself, and he spared no money to obtain the best materials from all over the world. This site is underrated and in my mind is about the finest home I have ever had the opportunity to view.

Would be much nicer if the furniture was still there. We enjoyed the house, but as we walked around we saw movies of the house with all its furniture. I would have liked to have seen the house without the bare walls.

Gothic Gaudi. What a contract to land at the ebginning of a career - contrasting with his later works, this is gothic in style and proportion but with so much inspirational thought - many of todays architects could learnmuch from a visit here !!

A weekend for two. We visited this fascinating place, full of amazing architectural structures and mosaic tiling, well worth a visit if these interest you. We had a lovely day in October to visit, we bought tickets on line for the central parc, cheaper and we avoided the queues, but we opted not to visit the the house, the queues were quite long about 45 mins and you do have to pay extra. The street traders are a bit monotonous, but the higher up you get the more interesting their wares and some great musicians near the top of the hill, worth the climb, but not for the less mobile. There is quite a climb to the parc from the metro, but we opted for the exercise/stairs rather than escalator to burn off the tapas and alcohol! But it was hard work at times. The views from the highest points are fantastic, but get the best on a clear day.
Guell palace. Right in the centre of the old Barri Gothic, shown to us on our Tapas tour. Well worth joining Alicia to show you around.

Nice but bit overrated. This place was destined for a resident area but the plans failed. It has 3 wonderful buildings, an open square with a magnificent tile coated bench around it and some other areas. It seems a bit overrated but if you visit Barcelona this is a must do.

Disappointing. i hate queues, and this is all u did here. Bit theme parky for me, The gaudy architecture was fab, but the queues for the house were 45 mins , you also had to pay to get in each place, bit of a rip of and also with a time slot.

Beautiful place. If you love Gaudi then this is a place you must add to your list of places to see. We were fortunate to visit on a hot day in October :-)If you visit the cross point you will get a great view of barcelona.
Gaudi gem. Worth the price of admission, including audioguide. Fascinating, beautiful, totally incredible what can be done with unlimited patron support.
Superb. an amazing place to fill your eyes with colors, sea view and if you have children for sure they will be entrained.

One of Gaudi's earliest masterpieces. If you're a Gaudi fan; a most visit one. You already can see his mastermind at work, although is more ''classic'' modernism then. Very close to the Rambla, easy visit. Don't miss the roof!

Interesting exhibition of Guadi's early work. It is a town house built for a wealthy Catalan to Gaudis design. Now run as an exhibition of Gaudis work. It is very convenient to get to from the town centre (in the Ramblas area). It is not as spectacular (except the roof) as Guadi's later works but has a lot of technical interest showing how his work developed. If you have time to see the development of Gaudi's distinctive style your should visit. If you have limited time I suggest the other famous sites. Or go back to Barcelona!

Wonderful building - don't miss it. Fantastic building and the individual audio tours allow you to go at your own pace. If you are a fan of Gaudi then don't miss this, just off the madness of Las Ramblas is this wonderful piece of art.Definitely worth a visit.

Great Architecture and Details!. This is the first time to see Guadi's work. We are impressed by the design, construction, and details of the whole building. 12 Euro entrance fee might be a little high but lower than Casa Batllo 21.50 Euro and Casa Mila (La Pedrera) 20.50Euro..

An other must for your visit in BCN. Even if recent changes have led to 'some (re-)organisation' and a lot of people here are complaining about the €8 entrance fee, it is actually worth it (at least on a nice and sunny day). You find a lot of elelements of Gaudi's architecture here again - you even start to suspect that Niki de Saint Phalle may have found some inspiration for her great giardino dei tarocchi here ...

Interesting architecture. Though I enjoyed seeing the park, and the price was certainly fair, if I had limited time in Barcelona it would not be at the top of my list. I'm glad I saw it but probably wouldn't go a second time.

Not what we expected. After seeing all of the Gaudi works (Sagrada Familia, Casa Batllo, and La Pedrera/Casa Milo), we were a little disappointed with Guell Palace. We had a long wait to get in. One of the main attractions is the mosaic lizard. Everyone was swarming all over it; it was kind of crazy! The gardens are beautiful. A lot of flowers. Other than that, there wasn't a lot to see.

Could not understand why they charge there. The Park really worths the visit, nice to wander, many artists but, could not understand why, but Too many " garbich " sellers, a big mistake since it undervalues the place. This is too much in Barcelona

Fun! Loved how he incorporates nature in his architecture. I should have mentioned this on the Familia as well, but I love the way Gaudi understood God and nature and implemented both in his architecture. Lines were short, but we had still bought tickets prior to getting there.

Awesome. Loved this palace. Gaudi played a part in the design of nearly aspect of this building, a true testament to his genius. Amazing design, each room has its own character, and fantastic views from the roof. Def worth spending a few hours and taking your time
Gaudi - that says it all!. Definitely one of the must visit and see in Barcelona. Amazing interiors and roof space along with a strict ascetic facade.

Worth a visit if time. Stumbled across it by accident and wasn't on our list, but not much of a queue so decided to go in. Close to Las Rambles and amazing architecture inside and out. Worth getting the audio guide, but bring headphones otherwise you have to hold the speaker to your ear!

Better than La Padrera IMHO. Very impressive especially since I was a novice to Gaudi's work. Make sure you go to the rooftop to see the chimneys and surrounding views. Incredible attention to detail in every room of this house. Every floor, window, doorway, stairway has intricate designs that flow from one area to the next. The audio guide was very helpful and worth the cost especially since I do not usually get them. Also, go to the basement to see where the horses were stabled. I personally think Guell Palace (Palacio Guell) is more interesting and less crowded. We went in late afternoon and there was only a short line.

Another great example of Gaudi architecture. We loved seeing this building. It was not super crowded and we were able to take our time seeing each of the floors and the super rooftop. Gaudi sure knows how to get your attention with his chimneys!

loved it. be prepared for a bit of a climb up to the park although there is an escalator,also a long wait to get into the casa,book tickets in advance,but the park is amazing and the views are stunning

great hike and amazing views. While waiting to go inside the "Park Guell" you have so much to discover! climbing on top the cross to see the views of Barcelona and also to spot la Sagrada and other places! Be amazed by architecture and nature, see parrots on trees, listen to some musicians and watch their shows. Such a magnificent garden. You can get free entrance jut to have an idea what a beauty it is, but better buy a ticket to go to monumental zone with all mosaics, and see Gaudi's house,"la Torre Rosa", admire unforgettable look of mosaics on main terrace, el drac (famous salamander), bench, roof, etc

Amazing Gaudi work of art. Was very impressed by this palace. Not very known as it took years of reconstruction, and compared to the other Gaudi attractions so much worth for money!! Beautiful house with furniture and an amazing architecture, and the top of the cake is the breathtaking rooftop with some views over the really cool Gothic area and amazing chimneys. Takes around 1h and costs 12€. very recommended!

Gaudi at his best. If you are in Barcelona a visit to this Palace is a must. Gaudi was commissioned by a rich man to build a palace for himself and his wife and the detailing from the harness rings for the horses in the cellar to the sumptuous fireplaces is worth seeing. An added bonus is that all the rooms are cool!

Showcase of Gaudi's genious. We visited this little gem as one of the first things after arriving in Barcelona. And we do not regret one single moment of it.Gaudi designed the Palace as a residential home for the Güell family, and while they clearly had more money that mere mortals can dream of, seeing Gaudi's ideas for a family home are so much easier to relate to, than the (also very impressive) Sagrada Familia.Included in the tour is an audio guide with an excellent English guide through the palace. Listening to the guide is highly recommended, and even though some of the praise for the Güell family can become a bit too much, it does explain the building very well.

A very special place to visit in Barca !. I have always loved Guell Palace, even if it means waiting for a couple of hours to get in. Well worth a visit with the family, as sights are awesome and so very beautiful.
A marvellous experience and not highly touristed. This is a must-see attraction and a Gaudi designed private home. One of the top attractions in our minds!
Guell Palace. Very interesting place to visit. Loved all the beautiful ceramic benches. Lovely landscape and beautiful views.
Entry barred. Impossible to get in ... three hours waiting time ... and that was at the end of Sep ... I can only imagine the chaos in summer ... book ahead ...
Very special Gaudi architecture. Very special house, was my first introduction to Gaudi's architecture in Barcelona.Worth a visit! :)

Gaudi at his best.. At a cost of 14EU, I think, I was luckily able to enter into the Palau Guell with only a 10 min wait. This was at 3pm on Oct 5. After finishing my tour, I noticed a MUCH longer waiting line. Lucky me. I spent a good two hours in there admiring Gaudi's creative genius and artistry. Difficult to take pictures, without people in them, but so many beautiful things to photograph. Unfortunately a bit dark for my SLR but it seems people with iPhone cameras were doing fine. Atop the roof of this six story building are several of his colourful ceramic tiled stylized chimneys on display. If you like Gaudi, don't miss this attraction. I liked it better than La Padrera, which was also another Gaudi structure.

Dr Seuss would live here. On a hot humid day we climbed our way to the top op the park and looked over the city. The architecture has no equal and is hard to describe, except that it will leave a smile on your face after seeing it.
guell palace. guell palacewas a very interesting building situated in interesting surroundings and there were plenty of other interesting sites to see nearby
Fantastic!!!. Yes, if you like to see architeture and Gaudi`s work you can not miss this place. It was not very easy to find but it was worth to visit.

Great views of the city.. You have to catch the metro to Valcara and then walk some but it is well sign posted. The park itself is free but if you want to see the Gaudi monuments and house he lived in for 20 years, you have to pay. Its better to buy tickets beforehand. We didn't but in fact it was much nicer walking through the park and listening to musicians playing and seeing great views of the city.

Don't need to go in. This was a 2 min walk from our hotel and the exterior is kind of cool, but no one was going in. Everyone just took pictures of the gate and then left. Absolutely no line up. The rooftop is very small (from what I can see from my hotel's rooftop), so it's probably not really worth to buy tickets to go in..

Thorough Tour. Architecturally speaking, this is not my favorite Gaudi building by a long shot - he hadn't come into his element yet. There are some aspects that are gorgeous, don't get me wrong, but it's no Casa Battlo. The tour recordings they give you there are very thorough though, they give a lot of background both on Gaudi and on Barcelona at the time, so it's worth the time for that, possibly as a first stop if you're planning to visit more than one of his creations.

The most impressive of Gaudi creations. No expense was spared for the indulgence-it truly is a fabulous palace where the Guell family lived. The palace is just off the La Rambla towards the Columbus column end.From the basement which was for tethering horses to the upper levels Gaudi is at his best. The organ in the palace is fab & we were entertained to a recital the evening we went. The roof has lovely chimneys akin to other Gaudi works
Hard walking. Great park loads of Mosaics and very interesting.very difficult if you have any walking issues.Great visit for me but not for my companion.
A must see. The art and creativity and detail in the work is like nothing I have ever seen before. Try to visit with a tour guide to get a better understanding of what you are seeing

Lovely gem designed by Gaudi. We loved our visit to this ornately decorated house in the centre of the old town just off La Rambla. It was open until 8pm so we fitted it in at the end of our Gaudi-inspired day in Barcelona. The weather was fine so the top terrace was open, allowing us to view the richly decorated mosaic chimneys as well as get great views of Barcelona and the local neighbourhood. This visit gave us a great insight into Gaudi's interior design flair, well worth a visit.

Amazing details. I purchased tickets based on the interesting chimney features on the exterior of the palace. They turned out to be the least interesting since most of them are not the originals, but restored. However, the interior finishes and details are absolutely beautiful, unique, and meticulously crafted with the best raw materials. The main rooms and entry halls are spectacular. If you did not know the address of the palace you would easily miss it just off of La Rambla. But if you are interested in Gaudi's creations, this palace is definitely worth a visit. It is NOT the same as the house in Guell Park several miles and a taxi ride away.

Gaudi designed house . We went here for 10 o'clock as it seems to get sold out quickly, (we bought tickets 2 days before)priced about €12,can't remember exactly,and it's a house where gaudi has designed the interior,very informative audio guide,and if you're into gaudi well worth a hour and a half visit

Nice place. I love the dragon but perhaps I would not go there on holiday. Scenic view was really cool but then I had to wait for 2 hours to enter the main area and felt like not really worth the wait.

magic. The most magical place in Barcelona! I loved just walking aroudn there and listening to street artists. We really recommend to arrive there after 20 - the entrance is free and there are almost no people - although it is pretty dark
Autumn family break. Pleasant park by Gaudi. Smaller than imagined but still some stunning features. Given timed entrances when ticket purchased

Good I visited it. Some people find it dark, and cold.For me it is astonishing. To be able to sense this you need to take the self guided tour. You may understand the details behind the different design and engineering solutions. Only this way you will aprehend it's uniqueness. It is different design than other houses of Gaudi. Built to be both functional and unique. Also, this same house if I remember correctly starts the fruitful collaboration between the owner of the house and the architect.

Interesting place.. We liked seeing Guell Palace, but it wasn't a trip highlight. We did enjoy it, but we thought the house could have used a bit more explanation. For example, where was the kitchen???

Out of This World Amazing!!. Wow, wow, and more Wow!I wish I had more time to loiter here .. what an amazing Palace, the likes of which you'd never find replicated anywhere else! Absolutely stunning in every way, with the highlight being the rooftop with the 18 mosaic clad chimneys. Mindblowing architecture, pure genius.

Gorgeous. Went following our private tour with guide at the Sagrada Familia. No matter what anyone says, it is a far and time consuming walk from one to the next. So if you are doing them on the same day and want to walk, plan accordingly. The grounds were beautiful and the museum a personal insight to Gaudi. Give yourself enough time to climb to the top if possible and sit and enjoy a Sangria if you can. I recommend the Hop on Hop off bus tour for 2 days. As they are both stops and you really get a feel for Barcelona.

Not what I expected. Very dark, built for an industrialist and very different to what we had seen and loved at Casa Batillo. Much stronger lines, darker wood. Also there was a guided visit which was taken into areas we were excluded from which was rather annoying when we had to wait to see the dining room for example. Loved the Gaudi chimneys on the roof but we had already seen them as we were staying in the hotel across the road.

Madness or Genius? You be the judge!. Designed by Antoni Gaudi around 1885 for his friend industrialist Eusebi Güell, this is an incredible display of either madness or genius, as his professor once said of him. Everything about it, every aspect of architectural craftsmanship is uniquely mind-blowing. The expense incurred in its construction must have been immeasurable because nothing is second-rate. You have to allow yourself at least one and a half hours to enjoy this and soak it all up. You will be provided with headphones in your entrance ticket that will guide you through each room and you will probably need to listen to the information about each room more than once just to take it all in. We have been told by the locals that not many people visit this Palace, but make sure you do! You can get tickets directly outside the entrance.

A fascinating walk in the park. This is a beautiful park and one of the most interesting. It does get crowded on holidays. Plan ahead to stay in the area for awhile. You can get tickets in advance. See Gaudi's house and wander the grounds.
Another Gaudi masterpiece. Another treasure from the fertile brain of Gaudi - the palace and park are not to be missed. Queues can be long- take water!
Make sure you have comfortable shoes. The wow factor was missing here. Typical Gaudi mosaic features but gardens can be seen anywhere. Would skip this next time.

I loved this. I spent most of my time in Barcelona searching for Gaudi not Godot. I traipsed around Barcelona, and really, just ate, drank and looked at architecture? I am no expert, but Gaudi is interesting and definitely strange. Loved every bit of it.

Well worth the entrance price. A site that's worth seeing. Take the time to visit the palace and you will not be disappointed. The audio guide that comes with the visit is easy to understand and use. Explanations are clear...
High above the city is a refuge.... Gaudi's park is so interesting and the views are phenomenal. Suggest early in the day before it gets too hot

You have to see some of Gaudi's work if you are in Barcelona. We went on our first day in Barcelona - you can walk around most of the grounds without purchasing a ticket but if you want to go into the park of the park with more famous Gaudi pieces you need to have a ticket. We had booked tickets in advance they are timed for entry you have 30 minutes from the start time on the ticket. It took about 30 minutes to walk around this part of the park.

Lovely place to visit. Lovely site. The grounds are fascinating.It was unfortunate that we had a deluge of rain on our visit but it didn't spoil our enjoymentBe aware that they have introduced timed tickets so it needs more planning than it used to.

A must-see sight of Barcelona. I was there this last Sept. and was not surprised that they are charging to enter the part A. Gaudi worked on. Last time I visited was in 1993 and it was free. Was it worth it? Yes! Every visit I see something new that I did not see the previous time. Closest metro station is Lesseps.
Fab !. Another must see ! Well hidden but was actually on same street as our hotel and we walked passed it twice! well worth a visit

Nothing special if your native language is not supported in the audioguide. My home city has lots of similar palaces from the times of industrial revolution, so it was not outstanding for me. Probably if you can take audioguide in your native languge you can make a it more deep experience.

Amazing Gaudi!. This is definitely worth the money to see the amazing work by Gaudi. I hardly knew anything about Gaudi before my visit to Barcelona, but the audio tour and seeing his work taught me a lot. It was fascinating to see, everything in the palace is so detailed and interesting to look at. One of the best things I did in Barcelona!
A smaller masterpiece. This Gaudi masterpiece is a smaller rival to his amazing Sagrada Familia. After the cathedral, I'd say it;s the second must-see.
Must see. This is a really nice building to see. Restaurations took 21 years but it's worth a visit now! If you like to take pictures, here's your chance. And the rooftop was amazing.

Unexpected architecture from outside!. During a rainy day in Barcelona, we decided to visit the Guell Palace. The place was very surprising! The architecture is beautiful and unexpected from outside.. It was a good learning on how people lived at that time and how much Gaudi was brilliant! The price is faire for a 1-2 hours visit that you can do as fast as you want with a audio guide in your language.

Superb Gaudi. There are many Gaudi buildings in barcelona but if you have limited time and want to see his work Guell Palace is a good option. The exterior is not as obviously Gaudi but inside you can see the architectural brilliance. Make sure you go up to the roof.
Very unique... and very Gaudi. I liked this place among the other Gaudi-inspired buildings. You can see the typical Gaudi architecture here. Definitely can't be missed during a visit to barcelona.

Afternoon of walking. Be sure to wear your walking shoes when you come here. You will want to see all the sites that are spread out around the grounds. Some of the places to see are up from where you start. The good news is that you can stroll on the way down.

Worth the price of admission. Gaudi really was an incredible architect and I'm happy we got the chance to see some of his work. Grab the audio guide, it really is helpful in pointing out things I never would have noticed on my own. The view from the rooftop is nice as well.
Beautiful. Don't miss this Gaudi creation it is well worth the trip and cost. The park is free but the inner circle showing Gaudi's creativity comes with a cost.

Loved it. Having not been able to visit this building on a previous visit this was on our must do list and we loved it. We have visited many other Gaudi buildings and looked forward to this one. Spent about 2 hours wandering the rooms and roof listening to an audio visual device. If you are into history and architecture this is a must.
another magnificent works by Gaudi.. another magnificent works by Gaudi. the collage works & facade interest me a lot. stunning view of the city from the top.
Guelli. Virtually all of Gaudi's places are worth a visit even if they are busy. Facilities are good and at Gaudi Parc the café is first class even with slightly dour stuff!!

Inspiring !. All about this place was wonderful. We got there after visiting Casa Batllo. Right across the street there is a bus station, bus (#24) directly to the park (~15min). We arrived at 17:30 when the next entrance slot is at 18:30. We did not buy tickets online and there was no need to do so, at this time of the day, no line at all. This gave us just the time we needed to take walk all around the public park and be at the entrance gate at 18:30. The architecture, the colors and the view were really inspiring

Park with a long history. We visited in September, not much in the way of flowers, actually it's quite wild and free, just how I like my gardens ;) Beautiful artwork by master Gaudi, his house is worth the visit, great view from up top of the monument and near Guell's original domain. The park has quite an interesting history.

Enjoyable spot in the city.. I am glad we were on a tour and this was included. We had our tickets and had an assigned time to enter. We had heard about the history of the park and then had free time to just explore. Gaudi was so talented and it was amazing to see where he actually lived.
More one impressive work of Gaudi. Nice to place to enjoy yourself with Gaudi' work and to relax walking around the buildings and gardensYou can buy the ticket on line and avoid queues!
Worth seeing. Although very impressive I don't think its the best of Gaudi's buildings (Casa Batllo is my favorite). Worth seeing however if you have the time and the cost of yet another entry fee :)
Best of Gaudi's buildings. Out of Casa Mila, Casa Battlo, Palau de la Musica and this building, this is the the most grand inside.

A good contrast to Casa Batlo. We decided to visit the Güell Palace after doing the Gaudi walking tour with Runner Beans Tours. The Palace is well worth a visit, the architecture is completely different to Casa Batlo and is was good to compare the two styles devised by Gaudi. The whole house is wonderful, but I particularly enjoyed the cellars (stables and grooms quarters) and obviously the roof. This was the one Gaudi monument that we visited that we didn’t pre book on line. We definitely recommend pre booking on line to avoid extremely long queues.I wish Tripadvisor would sort out the “wrong” reviews on this Palace; reviewers have posted reviews on the park in this section, a totally different area of the city and a definitely not a large town house!

Well worth a visit, especially for Gaudi fans.. Many of the other reviewers seem to have confused Guell Palace with Guell Park. They are miles apart and other than having been heavily designed by Antoni Gaudi and funded by Eusebi Guell have little in common. This is the mansion built for Guell on of the richest men in the world at the time. His wealth exceeded Bill Gates (when adjusted for inflation). The mansion is just off of lower Ramblas. The ornate wealth and Gaudi influenced designs are amazing. I thought the best part was the roof (can't go up if the weather is bad). There are about a dozen colorful Gaudi chimneys on a curved tile roof.

A window into a vanished life style.. This is about the PALACE not the PARK.A lot of reviewers seem a bit confused...We loved seeing this early work by Gaudi so carefully restored. And to understand how a successful industrialist could create a PALACE for his family.In some places the tour path was a bit confusing, but the audio guide was well done and useful. Having the organ play in the main room was delightful.A good education in design, and in history.
Severe attraction. A couple of nice sightseeing spots, two beautiful Gaudi buildings and not much more. The que for the tower was so painfully slow that we hadn't the patience for it.

Beautiful. We spent an evening at the park and found it stunning. The views of Barcelona from there are gorgeous. The architecture was so whimsical and just amazing. We even took some of daughter's senior portraits while visiting. What a beautiful place to visit!

Interesting. Interesting place to wander around. Lots of hawkers in the public section trying to sell their wares. Reservation to see the inner part is a must if you want to see it, although one can get enough of an appreciation without going in and spending the Euros!

Disappointed. I visited Park Guelle in 2005 and was amazed by it. I was so disappointed to find that it was no longer open to the public and you now need to book in advance and pay to get in. I understand why this is done but it just put me off visiting this time. By the time we got to the part of the park where you have to buy the ticket for I was also so irritated by all of the vendors and hawkers cluttering up the park. I wish the police or park authorities would please forbid them as they take away from the park and hassle people. In general it is a lovely place and so worth a visit as long as you have booked in advance and are prepared for it!

Another side of Gaudi. This is a very different side of Gaudi but all the more fascinating for it. The Guell palace is quite dark in comparison to his other work but incredibly ornate and outstanding. Just a warning, the roof terrace is closed when it has been raining so avoid wet days to maximise what you get out of the trip. We paid 8 euros [student rate] and an audio guide was included in this. We bought tickets on arrival and were given a slot to come back for. It was only a 15 minute wait and we had a wander around until we were ready. It was really good value as we saw large amounts of the building for a good price with a free and informative audio guide. A fuss-free visit and well-worth it.
Interior Designers heaven. Interior Designers heaven - but it is useful for everyone.Great restoration!It must be given at least three hours for the viewing

Parc Guell by Antoni Guadi is great. Take a cab there and it's only 10 bucks to get there. They have very steep hill. You have to be a mountain goat to climb there. It's not easy 2 get there. Take the 116 bus to connect to the train when coming out of the park.

Check the weather before you go!. There had been some rains before we arrived (around 3 pm), and then the roof terrace was closed afterwards for the whole day even though the rain has already stopped. It was quite disappointing as it was said that the roof terrace is the best place in Guell Palace. Therefore if you are going here I highly recommend you make sure it won’t be a rainny day. Luckily we went on 24 Sept when the entrance is free, there are some other free entrance days, check before you go.

Amazing. A house designed by Gaudi for the industrialist Eusebi Guell. Set over 8 floors, the audio guide really brings this place to life. Tickets (€12 euro) are purchased next door to the house, located just off La Rambla (& signposted from there). Includes audio guide & you can get the full length version, or a quick one. I believe there is also a shortened version for children. We ended up spending about 2 hours here - yes a lot of the rooms are unfurnished, but you are really here to see the amazing architecture. The place is topped by the amazing rooftop with the mosaic covered chimneys. Well worth a visit.

Great attraction. My husband and I truly enjoyed walking around this historic mansion. Having an audio guide available in our language that gave extensive detail made it one of the best organized attractions we visited. It is a grand estate with beautiful detail and you are rewarded with nice views when you make it to the rooftop terrace.

This is the thing to see. The Guell Palace was beautiful. We could not imagine how impressive and beautiful this place would be from the inside! If you have 20 euros to spend, go there, you will remember it for a long time!!

Best Gaudi building. This appealed to my sense of gothic style and felt this experience was better than Casa Batllo. So interesting, no queues and you have to see the chimneys and the stables. Free audio and visitor's map all enhanced experience.

If you enjoyed the Sagrada try this.... A park designed by Gaudi and the architect is as you would expect, it is very unique and on a lovely sunny day it's beautiful to walk and sit around.It's quite a walk from the nearest tube stop, but worth seeing.
Very beautiful. It is amazing and free, and also provides a free audio guide, so don't miss the chance to visit it while strolling around La Rambla.
Amazing Place. Do NOT miss this place. Some of the most interesting architecture by Gaudi that you can imagine.Must See.

Early Gaudi. If you're interested in Gaudi this is a must visit as it's a showcase of his early work. Entry is cheaper than Casa Batllo or Casa Mila, making it a good value visit. I enjoyed the temporary exhibit in the attic on the restoration of this building. The audio guide is very good and adds depth to the visit.
Go inside.. There are a lot more inside than the looks from outside. You dont need to make a reservation and the que shouldnt be so long.

Gaudi brilliance. A definite place to put on the list, though I would advise buying tickets online before arriving. Lovely organic forms and great views of the city. Plenty of Taxi's handy if the walk back into town seems too much.

Interesting early Gaudi. An impressive early Gaudi building that provides a frame of reference for his later creations, it disappoints in its understated decoration. Its value lies in its isolation of Gaudi's construction techniques from the decorative. It also provides an upper class contrast to the more accessible bourgeois efforts of La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. Still worthwhile but on a different level than the other Gaudi monuments.

A very interesting place to visit. I would recommend you take the time to visit the park and pay the 8 € for the monumental area. It is very popular and there are limits to entry, so I advise you book tickets in advance for the time you want to visit. You could turn up and take a chance, but be prepared for a long queue and potentially longer wait for entry. When you do get in some photo opportunities are hard to get with everyone wanting the same shot. It shows off Gaudi's work where you can get up close and enjoy it for what it is.

Well worth your while. This is a controled visitor venue; they allow only so many visitors in at a time. We waited 90 minutes for our scheduled time. So I suggest purchasing tickets in advance. Nonetheless a photo lover's delight; the views of the city, the mosaic tiles, the unique architecture, and more about Goudi. A must see.
Overpriced . Its a beautiful house, but the rooms are all empty and the price of 12+1 euro is too much. The rooftop is nice though......
Walking tour recommended. The first of Gaudis big projects, it is interesting ! I would recommend to do a Gaudi walking tour that gives u full information prior to visiting any of his buildings!
Another beautiful house. Of all the Gaudi houses we visited ( casa Mila, casa Batlo ) this one is perhaps the least impressive but we loved the guided tour and roof terrace.

Good visit. Book visiting ticket in advance or wait a couple of hours to enter. Once in well worth the visit. Guadi's museum is outside of the Guell Palace and needs another ticket to enter as run by a different organisation. Pre book as well.
amazing. so amazing. everything in park guell is soo incredbly interesting. gaudi was so talented & had such a vision.

Unique..... make sure you book in advance and book an early slot. By 12 noon it is packed out and quite uncomfortable. there are 2 areas within the park. monument area which is the chargeable part and most interesting(make sure you see everything in here as you cannot get back in if you leave it!!) I didn't enjoy the outside area as much but it is of interest and some nice walks and views. Beware the midges biting your legs around this outside area.

If you liked Casa Mila, you will enjoy this. Built basically for his children, Gaudi's work is well known here. There are times I had to repeat the recorded tour. There are 27. Once you understand the history, you appreciate his design much better. The top is the place to be but everything is blah. Sadly the neighborhood is not great either.

Just off La Rambla. Stunning architecture inside and we loved the chimney pots on the roof. If your time is limited I recommend Casa Batllo and La Sagrada Familia over this place but if time is plenty this shows another side of Gaudi's work.
Guell Palace. Another fabulous place with fantastic views across the city. Lots of greenery and lovely walks surrounding yet more of Gaudi's work in a central location of the park.
Historical site. Visited this location on a tour. It was hot, humid, and we were left off right in the front. Unbelievable work by Gaudi. A must visit!!!!
Worth it for Gaudi fans. This is well worth visiting for those who want to see Gaudi's earlier work. The chimney's on the roof are the best part of this mansion.

lovely park. did the bus tour, had to walk 15 mins uphill to get to the park, we walked around and up to the highest point where you can see over Barcelona great views, lots of amazing Gaudi work loads to look at, and musicians playing beautiful music in the shades areas, also lots of vendors selling tack, but excellent couple of hours

Good views of the city. Bit cheesed off as you now have to pay to see sections of the park (the seating area overlooking the city). You do not have to pay to get into the park but the way the entrance is now people think they have to pay to enter the park.
excellent. One of Gaudi's amazing works.Every detail was so impressed.A crazy design and creativity.Impossible not to admire Gaudi.

Disneyland of Barcelona. It is truly marvelous. It is fascinating to walk through this residential complex designed by Gaudi. There are so many magical structures that one is awestruck with the fertility of his imagination. He radically changed architecture forever with his work.

Stunning. I was so in awe of the power of this architect, and so pleased that some bureaucratic authority somewhere looked at his plans and said " yep - go for it", can you see that happening in Britain - no bureaucrat here would allow anything as attractive, imaginative and exciting as this park- bloody marvellous

Guided tour was excellent!. We booked a guided tour through Viator.com and was not disappointed. It's so nice to hear the history behind this incredible park. It was also the right pace for full enjoyment. After our tour we walked 5 minutes from the parks main entrance to an amazing BBQ with Sara (Eatwith.com). OMG, if you haven't eaten with locals, you're really missing out on a true Barcelona experience!

A pleasant park. Everyone raves about this park but I personally found it a bit of a yawn. It features Gaudi's influence and if that sort of thing appeals to you it will be a pleasant stroll for you. There is a great view of Barcelona from here and peo
Palace is the word.. Gaudi at his best. The audio guide we got was very informative and interesting. Very exciting to step onto the roof amongst the wonderful chimneys designed by Gauda.

There is a part of this park that is free. We saw lots of confused people wanting to go in but not wanting to pay. Go as far right as you can and you can enter the park for free. You won't be able to see all of Gaudi's famous creations but you do get a good feel for it and it's a nice place to take along some lunch and have a picnic. You can see some of Gaudi's art from the road through the gate.

Dreary, not your usual Gaudi architecture. We went here on a Sunday and queued for some of the 300 free tickets they give out at 4.45pm (be prepared to queue from about 4.20pm to get one). You get a free audio guide as well which is nice. We expected it to be all bright colours and strange shapes like most Gaudi we had seen, but instead it is very dark and gothic - lots of dark marble and wood and very ordinary types of rooms. I personally didn't think it was very interesting to wander around - definitely wouldn't pay for the privilege.

Up there with the best of Guadi. Off one of the side streets of Las Ramblas is another of Guadi's masterpieces, up there with Casa Battlo and cheaper to visit too. It looks nothing from the outside, but once inside you see all the intricate details, beautiful, colourful stained glass windows and all the Guadi touches. The only downside was that outside on the roof, some of the famous tiled chimneys were in a state of disrepair and some were covered up completely. But is still couldn't spoil an excellent attraction.
Another eye candy - not to miss. It was so wonderful to visit it! We were on the mission to see as much Goudi as possible and this was our first building to see. Beautiful museum not to miss
Interesting. This palace is pretty cool. It has tons of ceramic tile work. He was definitely ahead of his time in modernism and amazing detail. Everything little thing has a purpose.

different gaudi. unlike casa batlo and guell park, this palace is very dark. one has to look hard to see the quality of detail. also the rooms are square and the ceilings mostly flat. It was built for Mr Guell, its what he wanted. It has elegant and unusual elements,even the horse stables are different.

Don't let the outside fool you. I wasn't expecting much when I went to see this. But from the unremarkable outside to a journey of history slender and a meeting of minds Gaudi is remarkable and the palace has all the style and more. The audio guide was informative and I learnt about.

Go early to beat the crowds and wear sensible shoes!. The park is really cool and worth a visit in your lifetime. 5 Tips:1. Take the bus if you can, stops right outside the park. The nearest Metro was a 20 min walk.2. Go early, we arrived around noon and by 1pm it was packed which means taking photos means waiting3. Don't wear flip flops or high heels if you want to see the whole park. There are uphill areas you'd want to climb which you'd need sensible shoes to walk up (my friend rolled her ankle)4. Download the app, the audio guide is free5. Buy tickets in advance online, we were not able to and there was no line but we had to be given a designated time interval where we could enter and see the main architectural part.

A Treasure. What can you say about such an original and interesting building? Well worth a visit. Sunday afternoon was free from 5-7, but we went in at 3:30 when there was no queue and relatively few people. When we came out at 5 there was a line several hundred metres long. It's worth paying to help preserve such a world treasure. A good audio guide is included and there are free lockers too.

So close you cant miss it!. Right on La ramblas this palace is located and its only €12 each compared to batllo and milas €21 its a bargain. Batllo is superior, although they both have there highlights. The roof is beautiful, the architecture inside is stunning and again the use of light by gaudi is magnificent. Dont miss this wonderful palace guys. Plan for about 1 hour. P.s the €12 includes a very informative audio guide :)

Loved! . My friend and I managed to sneak in towards the end of the day to visit. I loved this house! It wasn't crowded like so many other of Gaudi's houses and the audio tour was very detailed. We had a great visit with a friendly staff talking to visitors and helping us all out. I highly recommend!

Not the gaudy Gaudi you expected. Do you like architecture? Do you like big houses & mansions from a previous age? Then you will enjoy this family home. This is not the outrageous Gaudi that can find at La Sagrada Familia or Casa Mila. It is, however, an interesting tour in a neighborhood that was home at the time to some seedy life that including ladies of the evenings, so this house is designed not to impress as much as to shelter the family while providing culture, music, vistas & a secret tunnel to the in-laws next door (if I remember correctly). The devil is in the details: note the floor where the carriages drawn by horses entered; those are not the bricks they appear to be but are cork so as to minimize the noise. Go down to the horse stalls to see innovations & up to the living quarters to bathe in the luxury. Take notice of the reception room with grates around the upstairs floor providing a discreet viewing area for the family before they went downstairs to mingle. These are just some of the gems money could buy. But oh! Go to the roof top for a taste of the Gaudi you've come to know & love.
Gaudi brilliance. Good value with a good audio guide. A stunning property worth about 1.5 hrs visit. A wonderful example of the overall brilliance of Gaudi.

very nice place. The enter to the palace is free, but if you want to see the bench of Gaudi for example it cost a lot of money. There is a nice view on Barcelona and a coffee house. Very good for 1/5 or 2 hours.

Must see for Gaudí fans. It has amazing design, small details that will wow, and functional living for the time period when it was build. It is Gaudi!The audio guild is included in the price of the ticket. We bought ours ahead of time online, just to skip waiting in line for tickets.Closed on Mondays
A bit boring.. I adore Gaudis work, but this building is probably the least interesting. Save your money for his other masterpieces.

Bucket list !!!. Was in Barcelona a week prior to our 24 day cruise from Barcelona to Venice! I always remembered his works of art in art school soooooooo long ago and was thrilled to be able to see all in person. Was a very humid and hot day when we were there, but such a thrill.

fascinating glimpse at Gaudi's work. Our hotel (the not surprisingly named Hotel Gaudi) was right across the street and from the front the Palace looks relatively modest (although the ironwork is amazing). But go inside and it's a different story. From the simple beauty of the brickwork in the stables to the weird and wonderful chimneys at the top, the whole building - and every corner of it - is a treat (I should say that a couple of the negative reviews below are reviewing the wrong thing: they're reviewing Gaudi's park and NOT the palace. They're in completely different parts of the city.). The Palace was fascinating and shows not just what a great imagination Gaudi had, but a great designer too: the combined salon and chapel, the beautiful conical interior roof space. We went first thing in the morning and it was very quiet,no crowds at all. Go see - you won't be disappointed.
Gaudi's Guell Palace. I've never seen anything like it! It's very unique. Gaudi is an absolute genius! Very creative! LOVED visiting this site!

Interesting Palatial Home. Please note that Guell Palace is a home designed by Gaudi for a wealthy industrialist and is different than Guell Park. The palace is very special and highly recommend a visit. There is an audio guide to explain all the fascinating details of this decorative home.

Very disappointing. I visited this park a few years ago and I loved it however now you have to pay for EVERYTHING! A minimal charge on the gate would have been enough but now you have to pay to enter Gaudis house, to sit on the famous bench and everything in between! Amazing views and lovely peaceful surroundings but not for those on a budget!

Well worthwhile. Any Gaudi attraction is overrun. So, we opted for our second choices and had a great experience. Palacio Guell was one of them. (Pronounced gwell.)Limited crowds. No waiting to get in. Includes audio guide that was really well done.Stunning and interesting palacio. Great restoration work.Good value for money considering you can't go anywhere or do anything in Barcelona without being charged.

Not what it used to be. Park Guell it's not what it used to be. Now it is full of people selling stuff on a white cloths on the street, everywhere, or other approaching with bottles of water. You have to pay an entrance of 8 euro per person (can be very expensive for a family with kids!) and still you need to stay in line long.The fountain is beautiful but so packed that you can hardly take a picture or enjoy the beauty of the fountain as everyone is trying to lay on it. From the main entrance you can take a couple of nice shots without paying the entry ticket and then just climb up to the park for a walk. For a better view of Barcelona my suggestion is to visit Montjuc with cable car.

Nice park...a lot to see and enjoy... Must see this. Nice park...a lot to see and enjoy..Gaudi master piece..Be careful with entrance. We were visiting in middle of high season and experienced long waiting time. You buy ticket now, entrance is in 3 hours. Try to buy online. There is a savings and no waiting time.

Hidden gem. Great place to visit if you like Gaudi. Tucked away down a back street off the Ramblas, it's a hidden gem, showcasing early Gaudi work. Good overview of Gaudi's life, you get an audioguide included in the price and it's a very interesting account. Well worth the money - and there are some fantastic views from the rooftop.

Nice Park. Palace Guell is just a very large, fancy park. There is a pretty cool fountain at the base of the main palace. The cafe is unorganized and the food is not very good. It was a good place to walk around in and just take some pictures (panoramic view of bcn).
cool place. What a creative and unusual park. I loved the enormous bench that was at the top. It was very pretty and amazingly comfortable.
Amazing Palace. very impressive architecture, just a 2 minute walk off Las Ramblas. Audio was excellent. Highly recommended in Barcelona
amazing. Arrive early. You have to book your time for the central part of the museum but the view is absolutley worth it.

Charming, but very busy. I was looking to this attraction more so than most in the area and it definitely was unique and interesting! The day we chose to see the park was unfortunately overcast and overcrowded, so that did dampen the wonderful colors that would have been brought out by the sun, but all in all that wasn't the fault of the park itself. There are spectacular views of the city of Barcelona at each level and there were even some live musicians playing throughout the park. Would enjoy going back!
Guell Palace. Close to La Rambla. Allow at least an hour and a half for the visitAudio guide included in the ticket (12 euros )Was worth every cent, a masterpiece of young Gaudi

Another must see. To see one of Gaudi's designs for a private residence (though it is a palace) tour this! Book on line for a specific time but once inside it is self-guided audio tour. Photos are allowed and there is much to photograph on the 4 floors! Plan to spend at least 2 hours.

Bizarre but interesting. This is park is a cross between Alice in Wonderland and the wizard of oz. it's not your eyes playing tricks. This is the real deal. Building inspectors today what have a nightmare of a time approving permits for its design, but no one can dispute the brilliance of it all.

A fantastic must see place but... We have visited this park a number of times and took some family members for the first time this year, we love the architecture and the whole feel of the park.However as with so many things can't believe that in the last 12 months they have now sectioned areas off and are charging admission for the experience. If there was a small fee for going to the park I would of happily paid, however it has been strangled by the greedy tourist board and so many parts are only accessible for a fee. Really spoiled our enjoyment of what has been a family highlight for us

fab. It is difficult to appreciate the Gaudi experience without seeing it with your own eyes. Many times we say a picture doesn't do it -- and this is that times 10. The pictures look spectacular but the city of Barcelona with all of the Gaudi work is fantastic.

Great Spot right in the city. Guell Palace was right near our great hotel (Hotel Montecarlo) and was a fascinating place to check out. I definitely recommend getting the audio-guide as it walks you through the time period in which Gaudi built this place as a family residence. We really enjoyed the architecture and the tour. Antoni Gaudi was a genius.

A Must See. This, was another truly excellent thing to behold. The world lost a fabulous architect in this man. It is so hard to pick a favourite of all the sights we saw. Enough to impress even an 8 year old.
Guell Park. a bit disappointing, not a lot there and very crowded. the "free" park around it is great, worth the climb to the top for the view of the city

Amazing palace. I've been reading some of the reviews and I notices lots of visitors can't tell the difference between Guell Park and Guell Palace. They are not the same place! This is Guell Palace (not park) a Gaudi designed family mansion and an amazing place. It represents the early architecture of the genius of Gaudi. Close to the La Rambla, this palace offers the visitors beautiful and modest rooms and an interesting family story. This is definately a place I would recommend!
Wonderful place to visit.. Though it was a dreary day out when we visited, the park still made you smile in beholding beauty and views. Wandering around the park made for a great time,

An Architectural Splendor of Godi. Gaudi adorned Barcelona with his creative design contributing to the wealth of Barcelona.Hats off to Gaudi. His ideas of incorporating nature in his designs is just out of the world. His window within a window concept is amazing. The structural balance that he has achieved in using concepts from nature such as roots of a banyan tree that he has incorporated in most of his design. Using designs ,colours and structures from flowers makes this place a WOW place for people who enjoy creative minds such as Gaudi. if you love art and unusuall design this is the place to visit. Don't ever miss it

A bit over-rated. After La Sagra and La Pedera, Parc Guell was a bit of a let down. Probably wasn't helped by being ripped off by the taxi driver who took us there - the only bad experience in Spain as it tuned out. (We walked back to La Rambla). The garden is pretty, the views great, but overall not in my top 10 for Barcelona.
Fun for kids too. Took the hop on hop off bus here and had to walk quite a bit to the top to see this beautiful Barcelona attractions. Such eclectic colors. The kids loved it too

A true gem.. Wonderful to explore a house that Gaudi built - rather than a public building. Worth the visit to get a feeling of how the privileged lived at the time. This little 'apartment' was built to entertain after the nights at the Liceu.
hidden gem. slightly hidden in a road of the las ramblas beautiful house lots to see. advisable to go early before it gets to busy free audio guide good aswell
Great Experience. Me and my wife really enjoyed it. Great Experience. We liked everything. Recommended to history lovers like us.

Easy to miss but a must see!. Guell palace is another example of the fantastic work of Gaudi. The gates at the entrance are beautiful and the inside is even more so. You will be fascinated by designs of the ceilings. this is one of Gaudi's early work so the architectural style will differ from some of his later works.

Fun but get a map. One of the most beautiful parks in the world! gaudi's home is worth a visit and be sure to hike to the top to see the lovely views! Be sure to get a map, we got lost and could not find our van/group for an hour!
Worth a visit. The audio guide provides useful background and information vital for appreciated the beauty and intricacy of this house. Definitely worth the 8 or so euro entrance fee.

A long wait in May. We arrived from the hop-on-off bus at about 5 pm in May (off peak) but there was a 2 hour wait to see palace so we decided just to walk around gardens, very enjoyable and lots to see. We still saw some Gaudi displays.

Very nice. I went here with a tour guide so no waiting in line or buying tickets. The park was beautiful and Gaudi's architecture was cool to see. Give yourself about 1.5 hours to see this and make sure you start where the buses drop people off. If you enter from the rear entrance, you end up doing quite a bit of unnecessary uphill walking.
Gaudi's work is impressive. Well worth a visit but pre-book tickets. The design is amazing and there is lots to explore within the park

Enjoy the views and the design. A lot of people. A lot of people posing for photos. So much to see and a lot of detail. We went as part of a tour, so had good information about what we were seeing and the history of what was planned.
another treasure of architecture. One more great building from Gaudi. Excellent,very detailed ceiling, a beautiful terrace and an overall nice experience

How Gaudi got noticed. This was Gaudi's first modernist architectural statement and it gives a thorough overview of his impressive talent. From the basement stables to the organ that fills the Palau with sound, to the gilt adorned chapel and the rooftop, one is awestruck by the detail in wood, iron, tile, and glass. Gaudi's genius is evident. This is a great place to start to understand Barcelona's most famous architect/designer.
Excellent. . Really beautiful and inspiring. Gaudí is one of the best modernist architects. Go there, you won't regret it.

Worth the trip. The walk up the hill looked rather daunting until we realised that escelators took you effortlessly to this stunning park. I had to pinch myself to realise that yes, I was indeed here surrounded by this masterpiece of design, enjoying a picnic and seranaded by classical buskers.

Palau Guell. Splendid - The visit is very complete for a very reasonable price - the building is very well studied with very rich materials and clever architecture. It seems very modern even it has been built about 100 years ago. Gaudi is definitively a genious

Another Gaudi master piece. Although it is also beautiful, it is not the must seen place for Gaudi's work. I only recommend people who has spare time in Barcelona. Crowded with tourists and not worth for queue for hours.

Magnificent "fin de siecle" architecture. This was Gaudi's first major commission, so there aren't many hints of the fantastical architectural vocabulary he became famous for later in life. But this was the private home of the same client who commissioned Park Guell, and for such a young architect to get such a major assignment with a seemingly unlimited budget was an opportunity to unleash astounding design. For fans of "fin de siecle" architecture-- Jugendstihl/Secessionist/National Romantic, etc.-- this is an orgy of delight. Meticulously restored, and so far not smothered by the crowds that flood Gaudi's other works.

Stunning architecture. This place was stunning, and there was so much to see - the architecture, the artwork, the stained glass windows - there is a LOT of detail. There is also a very interesting roof, and of course you get a view over the city. Definitely recommend going to see while in Barcelona, especially as it's centrally located and not expensive. Pretty sure the audio guide, which was very interesting, was included in the entry price too.

It was okay. Got kind of sick of Gaudi, to tell the truth. The palace is listed everywhere as not to be missed, but it was dark and overdone. It was quite a sight, but it can certainly be missed. It was impressive at the time, but I doubt I'll ever think of it again.

Beautiful Park!. This park was a little difficult to get to from Sagrada Familia. It was hard to find a taxi for a family of 5 and the bus ran very infrequently so we ended up walking. It was worth it. Gaudi is so unique and this park is a great blend of his Modernist view point and nature. Do yourself a favor and book timed reservation in advance on line. It's cheaper and you will have to wait otherwise.

Please book tickets beforehand. We went on Tuesday around 12.30pm and were told that we had to wait until 4pm to get in. Had to go again on Wednesday, the waiting time was lesser (2hrs). Park is very nice ones you get in.

Worth the fee to view. The terrace alone is worth the ticket price. The house will take at least 2 hours of your day. Buy the tickets at the door, but note that they limit the number of visitors per hour so you will get allocated a time to enter.

I wish we had parks like this near my home in the US. It was rainy the day we went, but we still really enjoyed this park. The mosaics and architecture are amazingly beautiful. You can tell right away that the style is Guell as it's very unique. The gift shop is really small two stories and hard to move around if there are more than a couple people inside. I think it's worth a visit, even more so if it's a nice day and you can explore without getting drenched.

Okay - worth a look.. It is a worth going and having a look at this park but I don't understand what all the fuss is about. To me it is just a park with great views plus quirky structures and buildings.

メルヘン！. とてもメルヘンで可愛らしく、テーマパークに行ったような気分でした！！！！景色も綺麗でゆっくりでき、素敵な場所です！！！
It was so cute and i spend good time in there. I really liked it! The view from there was also good:)

Wonderful, if you like architecture and history. Beautiful building façade, leads to an interesting interior carriage portal and stunning main staircase. Considering the site is only about 500 sq.mts, the design and layout is impressive. Gaudi influence is obviously present, but contributions by other designers and their attention to detail is noteworthy. Some of the ceiling work alone is mind-blowing.Included audio (and visual) tour, which was helpful but could be improved - visual component was too small to appreciate and required one remove the audio from one's ear and miss some of the narrative.On our visit, there was little to no furniture on display. Perhaps some was out for restoration. As impressive as the architecture is in this residence, it would be that much more so if properly staged with replica or time-appropriate furniture and decorations.

Another Masterpiece. If your a true fan of old architecture and design, these places are a must visit. The work of Gaudi is always fascinating to see, such a tale of twisted but genius work of art. Take pictures from different locations and yet it looks amazing.

Really interesting visit. An interesting visit with audio support that give lots of information on each room. Early Gaudi so interesting to compare with later works and worth it for the roof terrace. Building is full of fascinating details beautifully restored. Tickets are timed entry but we only had to wait 30 mins. in August.
Unbelievable. A must see. The architect was ahead of his time. It was jaw dropping! A bit crowded but worth the wait! Hard to describe the feeling you get when seeing this

The most representative work of Gaudi. I got an impression that It is the most representative work of Gaudi, since it is getting more and and more expensive to visit all others. Visiting of this place may give you a sense about Gaudi's work and save money and time visiting all others places.

Worth a visit..least favorite of buildings. First Gaudi I visited.. Just off ramblas. Very interesting, lots of dark wood. His first commission. My least favorite of 3 ( Pedrera , Battlo). But if you have time , budget non issue& architecture buff, go by all means.

WOW - loved this place. Even if you don't go into the Gaudi park (which I highly recommend you buy tickets in advance to secure your entry time. We wanted to go in but would have to had waited 2hrs for the next entry timed slot). Walking around the Park is lovely (& free). I loved the viaducts and the winding pathways. Remember its hot & humid so make sure you have water (although plenty of places to buy it). Gaudi's house is in the park and entry fee is 5 euros if you want to go in (we didn't). Lots of little shops by Park Guell entrance. Do go if you have the time - the views are amazing and the you can spend hours there if you so wish.

Hours of Entertainment. Loved this place. The architecture is so different. Gaudi was so innovative and there is still nothing like this work out there. There's a little cafe on-site and they were very rude. Other than that it the place itself was beautiful!
Guell Palace. Very quirky and not too busy ,just off Las Ramblas. Well worth a visit, you can get out onto the roof.

Great Palace. It's another piece of Gaudi's art... take the Audio Guide, it's very helpfull & explains all the details you can see in the Palace. if you love architecture, try to see all of Gaudi's work
WOW Again :D. Such an INCOMPARABLE place, finding the greeny areas, the new touch of New Barcelona of Gaudi Architecture :)

Beautiful. This park is amazing. The architecture is like nothing i have ever seen. As the park gets really busy we had to wait for nearly 4 hours before they allowed more people in. It was nearly 35 degrees so we went away had lunch and came back
Disappointed !. For the price and the waiting time, we were disappointed. Finally what you can see outside is enough. To be visited only one time.

Great introduction to Gaudi. This is a breathtaking building. Not as funky as some of his other creations, but you see all of the house, the roof is incredible and there is much to admire in the colours, shapes and designs of the interior and facade. It's free after 5 on Sundays, but expect to queue. In August it was very hot inside.
A sight not to be missed.. Some of these sights in Barcelona are over-priced but nonetheless they are something that you need to see on your visit.

Just so-so. On our last day, we trekked to the Guell Palace. perhaps because of the crowds and/or heat but we were pretty underwhelmed. It is cute and has some interesting Gaudi affects but for how out of way and difficult to reach, would have rather spent time on other attractions.

Love the tile lizard, nice park. Make sure you book your time online if you wish to see the paid area. This will save you some time.
